Input.Description: Any list of signals. Messages are constructed by evaluating message.subject and message.body against each signal.

nio/AmazonSES.Description:
Block for sending email via Amazon Simple Email Service
Html message bodies are supported.

quota.description: Returns send-quota information for your SES account.

stats.description: Returns send, bounce, and complaint statistics for your SES account.

message.description: An object defining the contents of the emails
message.subject: expression

creds.description: An object containing your IAM identity

recipients.description: A list of recipient email addresses. These addresses can be expressions. The expressions can also evaluate to lists for your convenience.

sender.description: Sender email address. Must be verified with SES. See below for detail.

Miscellaneous.Verification of email addresses: Each sender address used in SES must be registered and verified before use. To do so, visit the [AWS console](console.aws.amazon.com), select **Services->SES->Dashboard->Verified Senders->Email Addresses->Verify a New Email Address** and enter the desired address. Wait for the confirmation email and follow the link. You can now send emails from that address using SES!
